main.name: Ahmed Belhareth
main.description: I am passionate about building things and making a positive impact on every project with creativity and enthusiasm. Currently, I am a software development analyst at Linedata Tunisia while finalizing my engineering studies at Tekup, where I am in my second year. I am also into fitness and bodybuilding, enjoy playing basketball, and have some knowledge in marketing and graphic technologies.
main.bio: My name is Ahmed Belhareth. I’m from Tunisia and currently in my second year of engineering studies at Tekup, specializing in computer science. I am also working as a software development analyst at Linedata Tunisia. I enjoy watching movies regularly, playing basketball on weekends, hitting the gym for bodybuilding, and challenging myself with chess when I have time. I have strong skills in graphic design, video editing, and front-end web development. I’m always happy to offer support in these areas if needed. I look forward to connecting with everyone soon.

education.school: Higher Institute of Computer Science Ariana

work.title: Software Development Analyst
work.description: Currently, I am working as a software development analyst on a project called Nile. This project is linked to an external project named Chorus, which serves more than 9 clients and focuses on distributing financial information such as bond prices, rates, and coupons to client servers. This data primarily relates to financial products for clients in the insurance sector. The project is extensive and relies on legacy technologies like Sybase, Python, Java, as well as networking tools for server communication via SSH and MFT. Initially, I studied the documentation to understand the legacy solutions before transitioning to more modern technologies. I migrated Sybase components to Spring Boot and Java 17, adapting the old stored procedures to Java SQL. Additionally, I created temporary tables to preserve the old code while integrating a new, more innovative architecture. Furthermore, I developed JSON services to be consumed by a front-end interface built with Angular. Simultaneously, I am mentoring an intern who is working on the front-end development with Angular. My daily tasks involve maintenance, fixes, and implementing enhancements for managing the distribution of financial data. There are two types of distributions: dynamic distribution on client demand and nightly distribution of bond prices, rates, coupons, etc. Every morning, I verify the nightly distribution and correct any anomalies on the servers to ensure the smooth distribution of data, such as French Treasury bills (BTF), trading volumes, and so forth. I manage all environments: development, integration (testing), and production.
highlights: Software Development Analyst on the Nile project, focused on distributing financial information for clients in the insurance sector.
The project is linked to an external initiative named Chorus, serving over 9 clients.
Expertise in Sybase, Python, Java, SSH, MFT, stored procedures, SH scripts, and SQL.
Led the migration from legacy Sybase technologies to modern solutions using Spring Boot and Java 17.
Developed JSON-based services for front-end integration with Angular.
Mentored an intern in developing Angular interfaces.
Managed both dynamic and nightly distributions of financial data (bonds, rates, BTF).
Responsible for morning checks to verify nightly distributions.
Oversee all environments: development, integration (testing), and production.

work.title: Final study project-Full-stack Developer Angular spring
work.description: I completed my final year project at Neocortex Technologie as a Spring Boot Angular developer. The project was designed for sports associations and included a wide range of features, such as user management with roles, Spring Security implementation, post management with reactions and comments, a ranking system where users earn points and levels, match management with ticket booking, and store management where each store could be a collaborator within our application. I also integrated several APIs, including messaging services and an image upload service, using an innovative method where only file paths are stored in the database.
